name: Brumer–Stark conjecture
rephrased: The conjecture links the special values of certain L-functions to the structure of the ideal class group in an abelian extension, specifically stating that a specific element (the Stickelberger element) annihilates the class group.
implication_form: If H/F is a finite abelian extension of number fields with F totally real, H a CM field, and S, T are disjoint finite sets of places satisfying standard conditions, then the Stickelberger element Θ_{H/F,S,T} annihilates the relevant class group.
explained: The Brumer–Stark conjecture pertains to finite abelian extensions H/F of number fields where F is totally real and H is a CM field. It involves two disjoint finite sets of places S and T of F, containing all infinite places and all finite places that are ramified in H/F. The conjecture asserts that the Stickel (or Stark) element Θ_{H/F,S,T}, which resides in the rational group ring Q[Gal(H/F)], annihilates the class group Cl_F(S) of F with respect to the set S.
